data.title: Weather in Zagreb in December
data.meta_description: Discover the average weather, temperature and general climate of Zagreb in december. Find cheap flights in december and plan your trip to Zagreb on Avionero
data.text:
Going from a maximum of +61°F during the day to a minimum of +25°F during the night, the temperature in December averages around +46°F.

The average maximum temperature goes up 40% by the end of the month, compared with the beginning of the month, from +43°F to +57°F.

Zagreb is typically chill in December.

Maximum temperatures go down compared to the previous month from +50°F to +41°F. The minimum temperature also goes down from +37°F to +30°F.

Pack a jumper and a jacket as there will be cooler temperatures.

December is one of the coolest months in Zagreb, here is the comparison with other months:

December typically has worse weather conditions compared to November. It’s getting colder in December. From +50°F in the day, the average maximum temperature lowers to +41°F. As December arrives, the amount of rainfall goes down. On average, the rainfall volume decreases from 72 mm to 50 mm. Humidity rises from 85% to 86%. The average wind speed doesn’t change much during December, staying around 1 m/s. The days becoming less sunny, going from 5 sunny days in November to 4 in December.

But maybe it is worth considering traveling in January as the weather gets better.

The average wind speed is 1 m/s getting up to 3 m/s which is a light breeze; barely moving the tree leaves.

The average wind speed in Zagreb is gradually increasing during December, going from 2 m/s to 3 m/s over the course of the month.

December is one of the snowiest months in Zagreb.

Here’s how December is compared with other months in the amount of snow, total mm:

The climate in Zagreb in December has not changed that much over the last 43 years.

The average temperature was the lowest in 1980 (+57°F) and the highest in 2022 (+65°F). The driest year was 2011 with only 471 mm of rainfall, and the wettest year was 2019 with 1707 mm.

For this page, we’ve looked at the typical weather in Zagreb, based on historical hourly weather data from January 1, 1979, to December 31, 2022.

For past dates, we show actual recorded data at the location at that time. Forecasts are based on recorded weather during that day of the year, averaged over the total years for which we have records (unless stated otherwise). The daily temperature is the highest recorded temperature in the shadow during that day.
